decision_conditions: In the absence of any drawings and noting that it is unclear whether the use of the outbuilding would be ancillary and/or incidental to the main use of the dwellinghouse, it has not been demonstrated that the building itself would be permitted development under Class E of Part 1 of Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development ) (England) Order 2015 (as amended). Due to imprecise information having been submitted, it is unclear whether the outbuilding itself would be lawful under Section 171(B)(2) (passage of time) of The Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

In the absence of cogent evidence and information having been submitted, it is considered that, on the balance of probability, the use of the outbuilding as a hairdressing salon would comprise a material change of use of the land which would require planning permission. Due to imprecise information having been submitted, it is unclear whether the outbuilding itself would be lawful under Section 171(B)(2) (passage of time) of The Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
